results.title: Consequences: spinal cord injury
results.creator_credit: Peter M Jamero, Barry Corbet and University of Washington
results.brief_description: Contrasts the excitement and exhilaration of adventure sports such as surfing, motorcycling, skiing, skateboarding and hang gliding, with the potential consequences of spinal cord injury and permanent paralysis. Emphasises learning your limitations, respecting them and recognising the risks.

results.title: Connie the cow: a curious butterfly
results.creator_credit: Josep Viciana, Cristina Brandner and Neptuno Films
results.brief_description: Join Connie the Cow, the very curious cow, in six colourful animated adventures. We all know that Connie loves to explore, make new friends and play. She is young and very mischievous. Every morning she wakes to explore the farm with her friends and brings about some exciting adventures. Music by Josep Roig.

results.title: Confucianism and the Taiwan experience
results.creator_credit: Wu Li-Ching and Kwang Hwa Mass Communications
results.brief_description: Confucianism focuses on diligence, thrift, harmony and love of learning. This documentary looks at how the people of Taiwan have taken these values to heart in the economic rebuilding of their country. Modern Taiwan is drawing on the spirit of Confucianism for inspiration as the republic progresses towards the 21st Ccentury.

results.title: Confessions of a Simple Surgeon
results.creator_credit: Paul Harmon and Educational Division of N S W Dept of TAFE
results.brief_description: This humorous presents the associated health risks of smoking and passive smoking in an often graphic but factual manner. “Confessions” calls for a total ban on tobacco promotion and its message to viewers is clear. If you smoke, quit. If you don’t , don’t be conned into smoking and avoid being a victim of passive smoking. It is presented by Dr Arthur Chesterfield-Evans, whose experience in surgery on cancer victims led him to become an activist in BUGAUP (Billboard Utilising Graffitists Against Unhealthy Promotions) and in the legal activities of the Non-Smokers Movement of Australia.

results.title: Concrete practice
results.brief_description: SUMMARY:The film examines formwork in building construction andiscusses the problems caused by pressure when concrete is placed etc. Handling and storage of formwork as well as the application of release agents are also demonstrated.
results.description: SUMMARY:The film examines formwork in building construction andiscusses the problems caused by pressure when concrete is placed etc. Handling and storage of formwork as well as the application of release agents are also demonstrated.

results.title: Concrete on the farm: making good concrete
results.brief_description: Making good concrete improvements on the farm. Strong, durable, economical and fireproof, they improve the property in value and appearance. Step by step, we follow the methods of concreting a holding yard for pigs; the selection, testing and cleaning, screenings, gravel and sand; preparing the foundation; marking the bay areas; pouring; levelling the surface; the non-slip finish; curing and finally ready for use. Other improvements to fence posts, silos and cowyards are shown.

results.title: Comrades: a Lanternist's account of the Tolpuddle Martyrs and what became of them
results.creator_credit: Bill Douglas, Simon Relph, Film Four International and Skresa Productions
results.brief_description: An itinerant Lanternist is witness to the rural unrest prevalent in Southern England in the early 1830’s. He arrives in the village of Tolpuddle where the farm labourers form a union and strike when their wages are reduced. Arrested and transported to Australia for seven years, the film follows the fortunes of the five men until their pardon and return to England. Bill Douglas’ only other major film after his autobiographical trilogy, is a similar homage to the oppressed poor. However, in spite of its subject matter, this is less grim. An important work from a great filmmaker. Cameo appearances from Vanessa Redgrave, James Fox, Michael Hordern, John Hargreaves and Robert Stephens.

results.title: Computers: The Friendly Invasion (Captioned)
results.brief_description: Extraordinary computer, graphics and spectacular scenes from the terrific Disney feature “Tron” illustrate dazzling computer applications and introduce students to a fabulous resource. You will learn how people working with computers, can build a better world in the future.
